%1$s requests permission to exchange encryption keys
You have successfully exchanged keys, now you can enable message encryption
Immediately display the quick reply window
You do not have any encryption keys stored. Initiate a key exchange?
Request a PIN-code when starting the application
You received an encryption key exchange request from

TERMS OF USE 
 
1. FUNCTIONAL FEATURES 
1.1. The option implies encryption of only the text of messages, attachment protection is not implemented. 
1.2. This option is not available for group or community conversations. 
1.3. In order to start the exchange of encrypted messages, the interlocutors must go through the key exchange procedure. 
1.4. Messages can be decrypted only on the device that participated in the exchange of a specific key pair, on other devices, in other applications or in the browser, the user will not be able to read the original text of the messages. 
 
2. EXCHANGE OF ENCRYPTION KEYS 
2.1. To transfer the keys, the application will send several service messages directly to the dialog. 
2.2. The compromise of service messages does not pose a security threat, they perform exclusively a transport role and do not contain encryption keys in clear text. 
2.3. Removing service messages from the dialog will not affect the encryption functionality in any way. 
2.4. Key exchange can be repeated an infinite number of times, while new messages will be encrypted with new keys, and old ones can still be decrypted with old ones. 
 
3. STORING KEYS 
3.1. Encryption keys are stored locally on the devices of the interlocutors in permanent or random access memory (depending on the selected mode). 
3.2. If the encryption keys are lost, the user will not be able to read encrypted incoming and outgoing messages. 
3.3. The user will lose encryption keys in the following cases: 
- remove the application from the device; 
- clearing application data; 
- after using the \ "Delete keys " option in the application settings; 
- after closing the application (only for key storage mode in RAM); 
- when deleting an account from the application. 
 
4. DENIAL OF RESPONSIBILITY 
4.1. The developers of the Fenrir application are not responsible for the loss of user data in the event of loss of encryption keys or incorrect use of this option.
Choose where to store your keys
The encryption keys will be placed in RAM. IMPORTANT. After closing the application, you will permanently lose these keys and will not be able to decrypt incoming and outgoing messages.
The encryption keys will be saved in the permanent memory of the device.

This application is not designed to work on Android 5.0 sdk 21, because this firmware has a bug in the Skia module. If it crashes, disable the native library in the settings, but then you will lose stickers, animated gif, qr
